name: Hari Krishna Kosana
title: Power Platform & Automation Architect
professional_summary: Forged a ten-year career path building enterprise software that streamlines operations across Hospitality, Healthcare, and Government, now focused on legal process automation.
Orchestrated the integration of Microsoft Power Automate and Azure Cognitive Services to modernize legacy legal workflows, which increased process speed and reduced manual entry errors.
Constructed interactive Power BI dashboards with complex DAX measures that visualized key legal performance indicators, enabling data-driven strategy decisions by leadership teams.
Pioneered the use of Microsoft Copilot within a legal technology context to assist teams in document summarization and contract analysis, integrating these insights into automated flows.
Devised custom Power Apps canvas applications that replaced cumbersome paper-based legal intake forms, creating a central digital hub for all case initiation and tracking.
Guided the technical design of Power Virtual Agents to handle common internal legal inquiries, reducing routine request tickets and freeing specialist time for complex cases.
Framed a comprehensive architecture for secure data flow between SharePoint Online and Power Platform Dataverse, ensuring sensitive legal documents adhered to strict access controls.
Assembled a library of reusable Power Automate templates for common legal operations tasks, standardizing automation practices and accelerating new project kick-offs across departments.
Operationalized a suite of automated legal compliance checks using Power Automate Desktop, which systematically scanned documentation against GDPR and internal policy requirements.
Established a governance model for managing custom connectors in Power Automate, which improved deployment reliability and simplified maintenance for integrations with external legal databases.
Charted a multi-phase digital transformation roadmap for the legal operations team, prioritizing automation initiatives based on potential impact and implementation complexity.
Validated all automated workflows through rigorous User Acceptance Testing with legal staff, iterating on feedback to ensure the tools matched their real-world daily processes.
Synthesized data from disparate sources including Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, and SQL databases into unified Power BI reports that gave a holistic view of legal department metrics.
Mastered the integration of AI Builder models into Power Automate flows to extract and classify data from scanned legal documents, cutting down manual data extraction time.
Facilitated regular knowledge-sharing sessions to empower legal operations staff with self-service Power BI skills, fostering a culture of analytics and continuous improvement.
Cultivated strong collaborative relationships with legal subject matter experts to translate complex regulatory requirements into clear, actionable technical specifications for flows.
Authored detailed technical documentation for all deployed automations and dashboards, creating a sustainable knowledge base for ongoing support and future enhancements.
Reviewed existing manual legal processes to identify prime candidates for automation, presenting cost-benefit analyses that secured stakeholder buy-in for digital transformation projects.

responsibilities: Architect a new legal operations portal for a hospitality client using Microsoft Power Apps, which centralizes contract management and vendor compliance tracking on a single platform.

Establish a secure data pipeline from SharePoint Online to Power BI using Power Query, ensuring guest privacy data from legal cases is anonymized before analysis.
Debug complex Power Automate expressions that handle multi-language contract parsing, spending several hours testing edge cases to ensure accuracy across different document formats.
Present bi-weekly sprint demos to legal operations stakeholders, gathering feedback on prototype automations and adjusting the development backlog based on their priorities.
Built a custom connector with JavaScript to interface with a legacy hospitality compliance database, enabling automated checks against local accommodation regulations.

Test all deployed Power Automate flows for failure scenarios, creating detailed runbooks that the support team uses to troubleshoot issues without developer intervention.
Deploy the finalized Power Apps and automation solutions to the production Azure environment, following a staged rollout plan to minimize disruption to ongoing legal operations.
Monitor the performance of live Power BI reports, noticing a slow-loading dashboard and optimizing the underlying DAX calculations to improve the end-user experience.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for the legal automation architecture, including data flow diagrams and security permission matrices for internal auditing purposes.
Execute code reviews for custom JavaScript logic used in Power Apps, suggesting improvements that enhance code readability and maintainability for the team.
